exceptions.exn: In environment X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u a, b : nat f : nat -> X Unable to unify "∑ ?M1450 ?M1451 = fold_right m u (map ?M1451 (list_an 0 ?M1450))" with "fold_right m u (map f (list_an 0 (a + b))) = (fix msum (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) {struct n} : X := match n with | 0 => u | S n0 => f 0 ⊕ msum n0 (fun n1 : nat => f (S n1)) end) a f ⊕ (fix msum (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) {struct n} : X := match n with | 0 => u | S n0 => f 0 ⊕ msum n0 (fun n1 : nat => f (S n1)) end) b (fun i : nat => f (a + i))".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
m: X -> X -> X
u: X
Hmonoid: monoid_theory m u
b: nat
a: nat
f: nat -> X

Goal:
∑ (a + b) f = ∑ a f ⊕ ∑ b (fun i : nat => f (a + i))

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
monoid_theory : forall X : Type, (X -> X -> X) -> X -> Prop
msum_S : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ (S n) f = f 0 ⊕ ∑ n (fun n0 : nat => f (S n0))
msum_0 : forall f : nat -> X, ∑ 0 f = u
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t ?n) -> Fin.t (p + ?m) -> Fin.t (p + ?n) where ?m : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u a : nat b : nat f : nat -> X |- nat] ?n : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X Hmonoid : monoid_theory m u a : nat b : nat f : nat -> X |- nat]
msum_1 : forall f : nat -> X, ∑ 1 f = f 0
msum_fold_map : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), ∑ n f = fold_right m u (map f (list_an 0 n))
msum = fix msum (n : nat) (f : nat -> X) {struct n} : X := match n with | 0 => u | S n0 => f 0 ⊕ msum n0 (fun n1 : nat => f (S n1)) end : nat -> (nat -> X) -> X Arguments msum _%nat_scope _%function_scope
monoid_unit_l : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m u x = x
monoid_unit_r : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x : X, m x u = x
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
f_equal2_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> nat -> B) (x1 y1 x2 y2 : nat), x1 = y1 -> x2 = y2 -> f x1 x2 = f y1 y2
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
mk_monoid : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), (forall x : X, m u x = x) -> (forall x : X, m x u = x) -> (forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z) -> monoid_theory m u
monoid_assoc : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z
Init.Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise xorb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lxor (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise orb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.add_carry_bits : forall (a b : nat) (c0 : bool), exists c : nat, a + b + Nat.b2n c0 = Nat.lxor (Nat.lxor a b) c /\ c / 2 = Nat.lor (Nat.land a b) (Nat.land c (Nat.lor a b)) /\ Nat.testbit c 0 = c0
Init.Nat.land = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise andb a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.land (_ _)%nat_scope
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker_sound : forall (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof), ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker f w = true -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv Z, Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env) f
Nat.add_carry_div2 : forall (a b : nat) (c0 : bool), (a + b + Nat.b2n c0) / 2 = a / 2 + b / 2 + Nat.b2n (Nat.testbit a 0 && Nat.testbit b 0 || c0 && (Nat.testbit a 0 || Nat.testbit b 0))
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.add3_bit0 : forall a b c : nat, Nat.testbit (a + b + c) 0 = xorb (xorb (Nat.testbit a 0) (Nat.testbit b 0)) (Nat.testbit c 0)
Init.Nat.testbit = fix testbit (a n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => Init.Nat.odd a | S n0 => testbit (Init.Nat.div2 a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.testbit (_ _)%nat_scope
nat_rect_plus : forall (n m : nat) (A : Type) (f : A -> A) (x : A), nat_rect (fun _ : nat => A) x (fun _ : nat => f) (n + m) = nat_rect (fun _ : nat => A) (nat_rect (fun _ : nat => A) x (fun _ : nat => f) m) (fun _ : nat => f) n
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker = fun (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) => Tauto.tauto_checker ZMicromega.Zunsat ZMicromega.Zdeduce ZMicromega.normalise ZMicromega.negate (fun cl : list (RingMicromega.NFormula Z * unit) => ZMicromega.ZChecker (map fst cl)) f w : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula Z) -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker _ _%list_scope
Nat.bits_inj : forall a b : nat, Nat.eqf (Nat.testbit a) (Nat.testbit b) -> a = b
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
Nat.lt_alt = fun n m : nat => exists p : nat, S p + n = m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.lt_alt (_ _)%nat_scope
gcd.bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> gcd.is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}

```coq
unfold msum.
rewrite msum_fold_map.
apply msum_fold_map.
Qed.```
